unittitle.value: Charles Salk (Salkowitz) FBI Files and Corrspondence

abstract.value: Charles Salk (Salkowitz) was an officer on the New York City Metro Area Postal Workers Union (APWU). This collection contains FBI files on Salk and his correspondence with the FBI and U.S. Representative Lester Wolff concerning those records.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Charles Salk (Salkowitz) FBI Files and Corrspondence; WAG 283; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Materials found in repository; provenance is unknown. The accession number associated with this collection is 1950.279.
Charles Salk (Salkowitz) was an officer on the New York City Metro Area Postal Workers Union (APWU).
This collection contains FBI files on Salk, obtained through the Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) and his correspondence with the FBI and U.S. Representative Lester Wolff concerning those records.

subject.value: Postal service |x Employees |x Labor unions |z United States.

corpname.value: United States. Federal Bureau of Investigation
